questions.questionLabel: What is a component in Angular?
Explain the purpose of the NgModule in Angular.
How do you create a new Angular application?
What is data binding in Angular, and what are the different types of data binding?
Explain the difference between {{}} (interpolation) and [property] (property binding) in Angular templates.
What is event binding in Angular, and how is it implemented?
What is Angular CLI, and how do you use it to generate components?
What is a directive in Angular? Can you name some built-in directives?
Explain the purpose of the Angular router and how to configure routes in an Angular application.
What is dependency injection in Angular, and why is it important?

answers.answerLabel: A reusable building block for the user interface
A service for managing dependencies
A class that handles routing logic
A template for writing HTTP services
A class that defines a module in Angular
A component that handles UI events
A method for handling API calls
A template for creating components
Use the Angular CLI command `ng new`
Create a new project using `ng create app`
Generate a new project in the CLI using `npm init angular-app`
Create a new project from the dashboard
It is a way to bind data from component to view and vice versa
It is the way Angular handles HTTP requests
It is the mechanism used for two-way data transfer between the app and the database
It defines the way Angular manages styles in the application
{{}} is used for interpolation, while [property] binds data to DOM element properties
{{}} is for style binding, [property] is for event handling
Interpolation is for two-way data binding, and [property] is for one-way data binding
Both are used for two-way data binding in templates
Event binding is used to handle DOM events in Angular, using syntax (event)
Event binding allows two-way data binding between components
Event binding is a method for binding HTML events to CSS styles
Event binding is used for service injection in Angular
The Angular CLI helps generate components with the `ng generate` command
CLI is only used for serving Angular applications, not generating components
Angular CLI is primarily used for testing services, not generating components
You generate components using manual methods like creating a new folder and files
A directive is a class that adds behavior to elements in the Angular app
A directive is a service for managing application states
A directive is a decorator for styling the component
A directive is an HTTP service in Angular
The Angular router enables navigation between different views or pages
The Angular router handles all data-binding in an application
The Angular router is a service for managing component state
The Angular router is a method for rendering CSS styles
Dependency injection allows Angular to efficiently provide services and manage their lifecycle
Dependency injection is used to link child components to parent components
Dependency injection is used for binding components to their templates
Dependency injection is the way Angular handles HTTP requests
